availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Stewart (Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and juror)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and juror. Virginia native. Son of Harrison Stewart and Mary Stewart. Married to Mary Bryant Stewart. Father of Mary Elizabeth Stewart, William Johnson Stewart, George J. Stewart, Lucinda Stewart, James H. Stewart, Charles Stewart, and Malissa Stewart. Farmer in Campbell County in 1850. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860. Employed George Bryant as a farm laborer in Trigg County in 1860. Juror in the Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas B. Wadlington in Caldwell County on December 8, 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Georgia, Campbell County, District 10, p. 407B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 98.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Wallonia, p. 160B.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994056, Trigg County Births, p. 4
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994056, Trigg County Deaths.
Find A Grave, "William Henry Stewart (1823-1878)," Memorial #88151313, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88151313 (accessed May 27, 2021).
